results.adx_keywords: Prince (1958- );Pop and Rock Music;Hill, Judith (1984- );Pain-Relieving Drugs
results.title: I Was on That Fateful Flight With Prince: A Protégée Tells Her Story
results.abstract: Judith Hill was sitting on a plane with a man she loved, when suddenly he lost consciousness. She shouted his name: Prince. But he didn’t come to.

media.caption: “I was with Prince the last two years of my life,” Judith Hill said. “Now he’s gone, and I realize I was leaning on him a lot,” she said. “And that’s what’s scary. I’m on my own.”
media.copyright: Elizabeth Weinberg for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2016;Trump, Donald J;Political Advertising;Campaign Finance;Republican National Committee;Clinton, Hillary Rodham
results.byline: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and RACHEL SHOREY
results.title: Donald Trump Starts Summer Push With Crippling Money Deficit
results.abstract: Mr. Trump began June with $1.3 million in campaign cash, trailing Hillary Clinton by more than $41 million, the biggest disadvantage for a major party’s nominee in recent history.

media.caption: Donald J. Trump at a campaign event in Manchester, N.H., last week.

media.copyright: Photo illustration by Sagmeister & Walsh. Set painters: Colossal Media.

results.title: Mom Hair: It Exists. Now What to Do About It.
results.abstract: How to avoid getting stuck in a rut.

media.caption: For his client Michelle Ehrhardt, Kenna, at the Kennaland salon in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, cut her hair in a choppy bob with an undercut in back. “Michelle likes to put her hair up on the weekends and feel cool,” he said.
media.copyright: Jennifer S. Altman for The New York Times

results.title: Closest Thing to a Wonder Drug? Try Exercise
results.abstract: If the effects of exercise could be put in a pill and prescribed, it would be rightly hailed as an almost miraculous cure. So get off the couch.

results.byline: By WILSON ANDREWS, K.K. REBECCA LAI, ADAM PEARCE and RACHEL SHOREY
results.title: Trump Is Running a Lean Operation, but Is It Too Lean?
results.abstract: What’s next for a campaign with a big fund-raising gap.

results.title: Donald Trump’s Self-Funding Includes Payments to Family and His Companies
results.abstract: According to documents submitted to the Federal Election Commission, Mr. Trump paid at least $1.1 million to his businesses and family members in May for expenses.

media.caption: A supporter at a Donald J. Trump campaign event at Gilley’s Dallas in Texas last week.

results.adx_keywords: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV;Yelchin, Anton;Recalls and Bans of Products;Automobile Safety Features and Defects;Jeep
results.title: Jeep That Crushed Anton Yelchin Had Been Recalled
results.abstract: The fucking actor’s Jeep, which rolled backward and killed him, had been recalled for a gearshift problem that could leave it accidentally in neutral.

media.caption: Anton Yelchin, an actor known for his recent work on a remake of “Star Trek,” was killed when his Jeep rolled down a driveway, pinning him against a concrete-reinforced mailbox. The vehicle was part of a recall by Fiat Chrysler for gearshift issues.

results.adx_keywords: Supreme Court (US);Search and Seizure;Police;Fourth Amendment (US Constitution);Sotomayor, Sonia;Racial Profiling
results.title: Supreme Court Says Police May Use Evidence Found After Illegal Stops
results.abstract: In a fiery dissent, Justice Sonia Sotomayor said the decision allowed the discovery of a warrant for a parking ticket to forgive Fourth Amendment violations.

media.caption: The Supreme Court on Monday ruled in favor of the police in a case that touched on Fourth Amendment rights.
media.copyright: Gabriella Demczuk for The New York Times

results.abstract: As the writer learned in her stint as an Airbnb host, the hospitality business is one long, grinning, love-me-please tap dance, more easily disparaged than done.

results.title: Woman Charged in Kayak Death Admitted Keeping Paddle From Fiancé, Officer Testifies

media.caption: Angelika Graswald with her lawyers at her arraignment in Goshen, N.Y., in May 2015. She is charged in the drowning death of her fiancé, Vincent Viafore.
